Posts.Content: Just an answer off somebody who might know if it is allowed? I am on this site for the same reason as most other people as I also have breast cancer and not sure of my outcome either, and yes was just thinking of trying to make myself feel better which I do not consider such a bad thing. Sorry if this has offended you personally.
Posts.Title: Is botox allowed nearly a month since radio finished?

Posts.Content: Thank you Lulu for your more positive response. I did a bit more digging elsewhere (so as not to offend anybody) and found out it was ok to have facial botox as my treatment is now finished and am just on the Tamoxifen. I find out next Friday if my treatment was successful so fingers crossed. Tjuanks as well for the info on the breast info as heard something about that and it is something I will definately look into in the future as I do have a rather large dent. Thank you again for your support and good luck to you too. Hilary
Posts.Title: Is botox allowed nearly a month since radio finished?

Posts.Content: Well Sarah , what can I say it has worked better than I could have imagined, I do feel like the old me (well actually better) but best of all is that some of my family and friends who do not know that I have had it done have commented about how well I am looking and I must be feeling a bit better. I like it because it is not really obvious NO REGRETS at all. Will let you know how I get on with my results and a big thank you again for your support. Hilary xx
Posts.Title: Is botox allowed nearly a month since radio finished?

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, I agree and I think this damn thing does age you. I think I have aged 1 year for every month this has been going on but I think I am nearly at the end now and looking forward to moving on and this was something I thought I could do just for me. Well I did it tonight and they said it takes about 4 days to see the benefits but i feel a lot better already lets just hope I don't get up in the morning looking like the elephant woman. Hope you see the light at the end of your tunnel soon and best of luck with everything big hugs Hilary xx

Posts.Title: Is botox allowed nearly a month since radio finished?

Posts.Content: I finished my radiotherapy at Christmas and wondered does anybody know if I am able to have botox or fillers, it is something I have fancied for a long time but not sure if it allowed. I am only taking tamoxifen now. Does anybody know?
Posts.Title: Is botox allowed nearly a month since radio finished?

Posts.Content: Hi, I don't think that you are alone with your opinion and really sorry to hear about your mum. I too lost my mum 3 years next month and know how it feels. As with the botox I did it for me not for others and to be honest it is the best I have felt in ages, it does sound wrong putting poison in your face by choice but considering what I have had put in me lately it doesn't actually seem that bad to me especially with how much benefit I feel.xx
Posts.Title: Is botox allowed nearly a month since radio finished?

Posts.Content: Well Sarah , what can I say it has worked better than I could have imagined, I do feel like the old me (well actually better) but best of all is that some of my family and friends who do not know that I have had it done have commented about how well I am looking and I must be feeling a bit better. I like it because it is not really obvious NO REGRETS at all. Will let you know how I get on with my results and a big thank you again for your support. Hilary xx
